title: 110_s1582
content: The Act may be cited as the "Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Amendments of 2008". It includes definitions for various terms. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892) is amended to define "hydrographic data" as information acquired through various surveying methods and used in providing hydrographic services. "Hydrographic services" are defined as the management, maintenance, interpretation, certification, and dissemination of various types of information derived from hydrographic data. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 defines "hydrographic data" as information used in providing hydrographic services, including nautical charts, databases, and related activities. SEC. 3. FUNCTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATOR. Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892a) is amended to include provisions for the Administrator to procure, operate vessels and equipment, and provide hydrographic services to ensure safe navigation and maintain expertise in hydrographic data acquisition. The Administrator may procure, operate, and maintain vessels, equipment, and technologies for safe navigation and hydrographic data acquisition. They are also responsible for designing and operating real-time hydrographic monitoring systems to enhance navigation safety. Additionally, they can acquire hydrographic data to support coastal and ocean resource conservation, respond to emergencies, disasters, and homeland security needs. The Administrator can provide hydrographic services to save lives, protect property, and support commerce during emergencies and disasters. They may create joint centers with other agencies and award contracts for hydrographic data acquisition. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include a Hydrographic Services Review Panel with 15 voting members appointed by the Administrator. The panel will also include nonvoting members from the Center for Coastal and Ocean Mapping/Joint Hydrographic Center and NOAA. Additionally, authorization of appropriations for hydrographic services is addressed in the Act. The Administrator is authorized appropriations for nautical mapping, charting, and hydrographic surveys for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. Funding is allocated for contracting hydrographic surveys, operating survey vessels, and geodetic functions. The Administrator is authorized appropriations for nautical mapping, charting, and hydrographic surveys for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. Funding is allocated for geodetic functions, tide and current measurement functions, and acquiring a replacement hydrographic survey vessel for $75,000,000. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZED NOAA CORPS STRENGTH: The total number of authorized commissioned officers in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps will increase from 321 to 379 effective October 1, 2009, subject to certain conditions being met.
